"Life in a Northern Town" is a song by The Dream Academy, a British folk rock group. The song was the opening track to their 1985 debut album, The Dream Academy. Reaching #7 on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100 chart in February 1986, it was their biggest hit.

The song was covered by country music duo Sugarland, along with Little Big Town and Jake Owen, on the Sugarland Change for Change Tour. The live performance was made into a music video for Country Music Television. This cover was also played live at the 2008 CMT Music Awards on April 14, 2008. Although not officially released as a single, this rendition began receiving airplay on country radio, debuting at #57 on the Billboard Hot Country Songs chart dated for April 5, 2008 and reaching a peak of #28 on that chart. For the week of July 12, 2008, the song has debuted at #43 on the Billboard Hot 100 charts.

This live performance will be included on the Deluxe Fan Edition of Sugarland&#039;s forthcoming album, Love on the Inside, and on a re-release of Little Big Town&#039;s 2008 album A Place to Land.
